title: Anyone else hate the new Zac rework already
body:
I've played a lot of Zac and loved playing him but then they announced the rework, I got the feeling that they were gonna ruin him and i was right.
his ult is garbage in my opinion and is the main reason i hate his rework, the q is fine all tho i do still prefer his old q. his teamfight potential feels like there's a zoid now, like something missing  

I understand that riot is trying to improve the game and the experience of its players but.........    lately i feel like they have been taking steps back and not forward, but that's just my opinion

replies.body:
I have to agree that I prefer the old zac. Even though I played him a lot, ill admit he had problems. He was kinda simple, and there was nothing notable about him, other then Elastic slingshot and his passive. The problem I have is that his rework, plus the tank item changes, have taken a basic but reliable champion, and made him flashy, but so much less reliable.

For me, the new ultimate is ok. It lacks the old ults front line chaos, but it packs more options in how you can use it. It is however, way too easy to escape from. Any champion with a blink or a dash (so at least half of all champions, and virtually all carries) can easily get out of it before you can finish the channel. On top of that, it only does damage if its fully channeled, which kinda just makes a small problem into a big one.

The Q on the other hand, I do have a lot of problems with. If it wasn't for the fact that the buffed auto is so much shorter ranged then the initial cast, I would be alright with it. Unfortunately, you basically need to hit Q, then walk right next to your opponent for the second. This may not seem bad, but unless you have enemy minions next to you, I honestly don't see the point in casting Q. I actually wish the initial range was shorter, and the enhanced auto was longer ranged, just to make the ability feel consistent.

The health item changes are another big problem, since now abilities that deal percent health damage are weaker (Unstable matter), and its overall been a net reduction to his ability to tank damage.

So yeah. I do actually think that reworking him wasn't a terrible idea, but I do think that his rework was handled rather poorly.
